title: Iraca
text: Modern tools like Agent-Based Modeling (ABM) lately used create robust simulations epidemiological analysis; however, usually built specific scenarios rather general approach. analyzing vector-borne diseases like dengue, zika chikungunya, part process can standardized since vector (usually) mosquito. available tools libraries include general ABM approach; however, still limited modelling big volumes data specific simulations. iraca solves need ABM focused Human-Mosquito interaction ’s specific enough capture behavior disease, time flexible consider multiple scenarios. library aimed epidemiologists, researchers, local public health decision-makers, anyone interested dynamics vector-borne diseases.

title: Iraca
text: user interact library using model object required information. Users input direct information National Geostatistical Framework provided National Department Statistics (DANE). dataset include socioeconomic demographic details municipalities country. addition, climate data Institute Hydrology, Meteorology Environmental Studies included simulate weather patterns. looking fitted calibration, observed cases period interest required, used calculate set parameters best fit real data minimizing RMSE. Finally, simulation can run without interventions, either recreate past events evaluate future scenarios. simulation allows differentiation three types agents: humans, mosquitoes territories. three created input data stated , assigned different movement behavioral patterns. Interventions can also included simulation, including use mosquito nets, insecticides container cleaning. set model, can use function setup. Users may also indicate different incubation infection periods, well initial parameters regarding infected population (humans mosquitoes). setting model, can start model make simulation given amount days (steps). allow larger faster simulations, model implementation relies C++ liked R Rcpp. library uses S3 objects make data input output simple possible user.
code: library(iraca)  # load example data, which is from the city of Ibague, Colombia data(demographic_data_ibague) data(temperature_data_ibague)  # Setup model model <- setup(   demographic_data = demographic_data_ibague,   temperature_data = temperature_data_ibague,   movement_data = NULL,   demographic_data_MGN = TRUE,   divipola_code = NULL,   disease = "dengue",   incubation_period = 4,   infection_duration = 14,   init_infected_humans = 0.005,   init_infected_mosquitoes = 0.03 ) simulation(ABM_data = model,            time = 100)

title: Setup ABM data and basic parameters — setup
text: demographic_data sf object demographic data specified format. expected input user DANE´s MGN (Marco Geoestadístico Nacional). temperature_data Data frame temperature historic. expected input historic data IDEAM´s historic temperature movement_data Data frame movement flow territories. provided automatically calculated demographic data using distance population. demographic_data_MGN Boolean stating data directly downloaded MGN needs filtering cleaning. divipola_code Divipola code municipality simulated disease Character string disease name. Can either "dengue", "zika" "chikungunya". incubation_period Incubation period disease. infection_duration Infection duration disease. init_infected_humans Percentage initially infected humans. init_infected_mosquitoes Percentage initially infected mosquitoes.
